title: How about giving ruby sightstone a unique passive: increase stealth warding limit by one?
body:
I want to have more control over the vision as a support. When my teammates refuse to help with vision, at least I can do something to compensate.
Moreover it gives people more reasons to upgrade the sightstone to ruby sight stone.
Edit:
Hi! Haven't checked my post for such a long time and didn't realize it got so many relies and my first red reply :3. Thank you for joining the discussion.

 I  only intended to ask for an extra green (stealth)warding limit for supports, and maybe give a bit more reason to upgrade my ruby sightstone. 

So some people worried that vision will become supports' job again, which I don't think would become a problem. Even now support is taking a large part of it, adding some more vision control for supports won't hurt.

Other suggestions like granting a small movement speed buff while warding would be great. (Although there should a cd to prevent spamming wards to escape. that destroyed the meaning of warding)

There's a question people are asking : Why not make sightstone a more proper build for other laners if warding is not only the job for support? And there are many nice suggestions about. What do riot think about this idea?

replies.body: I think that a few items need a fourth tier, and sightstone is definitely one of them. I'd like to see a 'diamond' sightstone, for example.
Oooh. How about "diamond" sightstone also increases your FoW vision radius slightly? :o  That way it incentivizes not only supports to buy it...

Why don't we have two Sightstones?

* **Ruby Sightstone:** Grants health.
* **Sapphire Sightstone:** Grants mana.
{{champion:44}}  So many gems...
Why not both? Make it an absurdly high price, but there could be a fusing of the two items to give you Health and Mana, almost like a RoA without the AP?

Just an idea but what if you gain a ward stack for every ward you clear? What I mean is if you have a sightstone with only 2 ward stacks left, and you sweep an enemy ward and kill it you would gain a ward stack which means you now have 3 ward stacks on your sightstone. 

It's a small change overall but allows you to stay grouped with your team longer instead of having to recall for more wards, especially useful late game when it's a constant vision struggle.

EDIT: To clarify the ward cap on sightstone would remain the same this is just an idea to help refresh wards by actively interacting with the vision game instead of just recalling for more wards.

I like this idea. A lot. As a support Janna main that rarely gets large amounts of vision help from my team, it's very annoying to be running around with no wards remaining because I can't risk going back yet.

What about Enchanted and Plated Sightstone.
Give it a build path with MR or Armor which also give different unique passives.

Plated Sightstone could give your Wards defense from sweepers, maybe make them immune for half the duration of the sweeper to stop walk by solo sweeping.

I dont have an idea for enchanted sightstone though.

With their only method of removal being through sweeper, I don't think that would be an adequate method of making it better, as it would make some champs that have lower attack speed unable to clear it fast enough. This is made only worse since usually no more than 2 people on a team have sweeper.

There are plenty of treads out there though to discuss the hundreds of possible ward ideas, and I think anything other than number manipulation to the base properties of a ward (health, duration, sight radius, etc) would make wards either too strong or unnecessarily complex. If they did increase the stats though, they should absolutely make them defensive.
Perhaps the defensive one could increase the ward "health" putting it at four aa's to destroy instead of 3?
But Lee Sin is supposed to be blind! How can he get greater vision radius?!? 0_o
How about a new ward that can see through terrain?
That's not what I call a ward...

Yes please, i mean at the very least it does need something to make it worth dumping gold into beyond the regular sightstone(or end of game max gold) :)

Also, I think something perhaps non-gameplay related should be done to warding just to let everyone know it's not just the supports job.  There are an amazing amount of players who either only buy 1 or 2 wards during laning and that's all, or none at all, assuming it's someone else's job.  

Edit:  What if people got a small amount of gold for a champion who was killed after entering that player's ward range?  It isn't non-gameplay, but it would probably really encourage ward buying I would think.

Immediate knee-jerk reaction: *awesome idea*
Immediate knee-jerk action: *make post of the day*

Let's discuss! What are the benefits and potential ramifications of this proposed change?

Personally I feel it as a good thing as it would make getting the ruby sightstone upgrade worth it beyond if you were at a full build. Often there doesn't seem to be a need to upgrade the sightstone because of the ward limit given this season being less than 4, so  you often don't exhaust a standard sightstone before backing. Another suggestion that I rather like would be to give it an extended warding range a la Feral Flare.
Alternately, I would support nerfing Sightstone to 1 ward and making Ruby Sightstone the 3-ward version. Although I like the increased warding range--maybe for a Legendary Sightstone item?

Nerfing sightsone to one ward would make it a really painful item for supports to get, as that slot would be reserved for one ward. With green wards you can stack them so I would expect a change like that to make people opt for just buying greens.

Maybe I'm just crappy support or maybe I just get good ADCs a lot, but between two green trinkets (mine and ADC) and a one-ward Sightstone, I consider early-game warding covered. Usually I'll even sell Sightstone for an AP item late game. I never get it jungling, between Wriggle's and trinket.

Am I really crappy support? Can anyone point me to a good warding guide?

Ideally you should sell you're trinket to get the sweeping lens as soon as you get sightstone so you can deward. You should be making more use of the sightstone, it looks like, because you want to give your team vision control. I would point you too a warding guide, but that last one I really looked at was early last season and then just looked at the spots that pros tend to ward while using some common sense. Don't ward willy nilly, but warding objectives like Dragon, Baron, and enemy buffs if you have safety to do so, can be incredibly advantageous. In lane you should have at least one ward in the river and at least one in the lane bush that has or had an enemy in it.

The keyword with the enemy buffs was safety.  You would not believe the number of people I see just wandering into the enemy jungle with 3 or more mias and then raging because no one helped them since they were "warding".  Always keep an eye ont he map when warding.  Excluding the jungler, you should never ward alone if there is someone not visible.  I used to do this back when I was new to supporting.  Let me tell you, you fell like a complete asshat when you go to place a ward and the enemy mid is right there waiting.

I play support for most of the time, and I think that we could -Use- (not mandatory) that extra ward... Or at least get something to alter the wards, how about a mastery that would extend the duration of wards by 20% or -insert number here-? It could be placed in Alchemist mastery which extends duration of potions/flasks.

Pros: Definitely makes Ruby SS worth buying. Gives supports a much-needed assist in the warding department, and may even incentivize other positions/roles to begin purchasing the SS. It also opens up the possibility of opening up a Sightstone "Item-Line", much like how Ruby Crystal builds into a ton of things, so could the SS. 
Cons: **Could incentivize other roles into warding much more often, turning back the clock on vision changes made earlier.** It could also do the reverse, pigeon-holing supports and/or junglers into being their teams only source of wards. It could cause spikes of power in champions that jump to wards, or rely on vision for ultimates (Lee Sin, Caitlyn, Nocturne, to name a few) simply because they are now more mobile (The Blind Monk...jumps everywhere...), or can now more reliably use their ultimate (Nocturne, Ziggs, Xerath, Jinx, Ezreal).
Side Note: >.> Actual productive discussion; so many good/cool ideas everywhere
Please don't do it. Pigeon holes supports like during the pre-vision change times.
Oh did you mean VISION (pink) ward?  I am assuming that is what this discussion is about :x
I think he was implying on increasing the green ward limit by 1. Not sure how Ruby Sightstone would work with both ward types being able to be used by it.

Assuming pink ward limit +1: essentially it's just a passive benefit that allows you to place two pink wards. It wouldn't mean that the sightstone dispenses the pink ward--you'd have to buy two.

Perhaps he did think about green wards when writing this post--but pink ward limits apply too!  There are many times as a support I wish I could keep a ward in bot lane tri so my adc/splitpusher can safely farm while I keep an "eye" on Baron.

Okay, while I hate to disagree with this idea, because I'd like to see more meaningful support items one day, I think you're missing some major problems in the hyped-up giddy state:

1) The whole reason vision got reworked is because people refused to buy wards because it's "the support's job", and putting an extra ward on the Sightstone might reinforce this mentality again, possibly too heavily.

2) I'm sorry, I sound like a vengeful douche, but making a version of sightstone that allows more sight and grants more HP (Diamond, or even just buffs to red) is indirectly potentially (or probably, imo) a Lee Sin buff. As someone who's mained jungle since I learned what it was 3+ years ago, I'm HEAVILY against Lee Sin buffs. Giving the ridiculously strong, low-level power, invading gank jungler more vision passively in FoW and an extra ward, plus more W jumping? That's just not going to be okay.

3) Some of you will say "PSSH NOBODY BUYS SIGHTSTONE ON LEE SIN", or "Dude you're being paranoid", I *promise* you if you make sightstone a remotely viable health item, or even just an item worthwile on things besides supports, ***the pro teams will start buying it***. They will. I promise. Vision is arguably the most powerful but most underrated control of the game you can get. If your tankish jungler can buy an item that gives more defenses and more vision/warding, particularly if they can jump to wards (*cough cough*), they're gonna get it in pro teams.

4) Too many stats on it and anyone who can itemize defenses might get it, and Jungling is in piss-poor state as-is for ganking. Too much vision, too much of a push for tank jungles from Riot, too much nerfing of assassins (some of which who have to still jungle, guys), etc. More vision on that top lane Nasus you're trying to gank is just not good, and passive gameplay when they game already currently favors late-game playstyles is not what we really need right now.


If you're going to give it cool effects, I don't think under any circumstances you should give it more stats. If it's going to be bought, it needs to be bought PURELY for the vision benefits. No more defenses, no move speed, no cdr, no Gp/10, nothing. Any of those things can be used on other roles/lanes besides supports and if it becomes viable as anything more than a vision item it's going to cause a lot of issues.

Again, sorry to sound like I hate the idea, I don't, I'd love to make Sightstone better, I'm saying the state of the game can't take it right now. I'd love to make Youmou's Ghostblade better too, but that'd cause problems everyone can see. Get what I'm saying?

Dude! You don't have to apologize for offering a dissenting opinion. That's the whole point of a discussion! :) The Post of the Day isn't necessarily always highlighting something AWESOME OMG YES---sometimes it's an opportunity to highlight a fantastic discussion point--and as we're coming up on the 2015 season, this is a great one to have! :)

Thanks, but I've uttered some words that are forbidden on here when I say "Don't give support items more power" or "don't buff Lee Sin".

I'm dangerously close to "LoL Forum Blasphemy" :P

That said, do you have opinions from a Rioter's perspective on what I've said? 
Curious to get some inside feedback as to how you guys would feel about granting unintended power to roles outside of supports, or (even less) power to gank-reliant junglers through vision buffs (and dw I know you don't work Live Balance, not going to trashtalk you lol)

While your points are valid, as a support player, I am buying sight stone. And while Lessing the burden has been met by offering this item, without a incentive to upgrade, Ruby is worthless.  So rather to nit pick the negatives, over something as an alternative. 

I would like to see the vision range and drop range increased by XX%. 

Also offering a third tier to increase the health of all wards placed by this champion by 2.

Late game warding is a problem for supports, so increasing the safety of performing this task may make it a viable upgrade.

***About warding power***
----------
I agree lategame warding is hard in solo queue, for sure, mostly outta laziness IMO (90% of games I and the supp are the only ones who even buy the friggin' trinket upgrades).

I'm not nit-picking the negatives here though, I'm talking about major problems that **will** happen outside of support-world if any sort of big buffs go through for sightstone. 

People hardcore tunnel-vision on their role and don't realize you can't do ANYTHING to items without affecting all champs who can use it in the game. 

I speak mostly as a Jungle main, so for comparison, if the jungle items were REMOTELY viable on laners, the laners would buy them, and this is a problem that has happened multiple times in the past. 

Unless you can lock a powerful item *intended* for one role *to* that role, you can't give major buffs to the item, really. Jungle items have the gate of "X affects only monsters" which allows it to be jungler-only, but sightstone has no such gate.

***About how the item's unintended effects***
---------

The problem you encounter is that if you give bonus vision to sightstone, it's not just supports who will be using it, the Junglers who can itemize it and the Mids (not many, maybe like Swain), and the tops (Much more than mid) who want extra vision without risky ward placement will buy it too, because defenses are universally helpful and if Sightstone gave any more, it might be gold efficient out of sheer hp gain.  That's why Feral Flare has such a huge ward place range, it's incredibly strong to have safe warding power in the jungle.

Have to bring up ganking again, as atm it's in a piss-poor spot with the free warding already + permanent wards through pinks if used correctly. Not to mention the constant blows to assassins.

I understand Supports want more vision and better itemization and ward safety...
But as a jungle assassin, I'd love to have 30% more damage when leaving the jungle, the ability to nuke stealthed wards from range and without sight, and an item granting free stealth. But that would ruin other roles and be insanely frustrating to the people who it'd cause problems for, just like Sighstone buffs would be for the people who have to actively monitor all the wards in the entire game to be successful.

It's just not an item buff that can be justified without equally powerful ward removal tools.

Perhaps if the buffs were gated by the "diamond" sightstone being very costly (meaning Legendary/Mythical tier, so 3k+ **minimum**) , or the effects gated by champion level, it'd be okay, because then it'd be locked to the late midgame or early lategame at the earliest. If the intent really is more lategame warding power, then this might accomplish that. But the fact is, ganking's state is pathetic enough as-is, more lane warding will knock all but afk farming junglers completely out of the game.

Well, if anything, I do think ruby sight stone needs more incentive to be purchased atm. Cuz when I'm relegated to supp, I find myself getting sight stone, but never seeing any reason to upgrade it. The cost just isn't worth the reward anymore ever since the vision changes.

Why not try something like a new passive like this: Passive - increases ward vision range by X%

If it was the pink ward limit, you'd end up with a cascade effect forcibly pushing supports back into wardbot - it'd be expected they'd take it for the extra slot (more money spent on upgrading one item) *and* then buy the extra pinks to make use of it (more money spent buying additional wards, which is what Sightstone is supposed to *counteract*).

Are you talking about increasing green ward or pink ward limit?

If you're talking about increasing the green ward limit, I think that would undo the effort put into the season 4 changes that aimed to shift supports away from the role of "ward dispenser". Riot wants vision to be a team effort. Sightstone is a cheap pickup that, really, anybody could buy, but supports often end up buying it because they generally don't scale as hard with gold, other lanes have more uses for the item slot and extra gold. 

If we increase the green ward limit by one on ruby sightstone, not only does it force supports to go for it (as we need vision, and they already have the sightstone), it would require us to even stock up on an extra green ward or two, to keep up with having four wards down at once, plus all the scanning that goes on. Sightstone is meant to be an item which puts an end to ward buying. If you own a sightstone, you should not need to buy another green ward that game. Having a four ward limit late game, and trying to keep up with making use of that extra limit means we have to buy at least one or two extra green wards - this is bad.

If you're talking about increasing the pink ward limit, it would be a kind of niche upgrade (if they have lots of stealth then it might be useful), but again, it's forcing supports to make use of that two ward limit. Pink wards are fairly expensive, and if we choose to invest another 475g into a pink trinket to make use of the extra limit, we're sacrificing scanning for wards every minute. It would leave a hefty hole in the support's not-so-deep pockets.


One minor buff to a ruby sightstone is something I wouldn't mind seeing - assuming it doesn't become a mandatory rush. I'd love to see an upgrade that becomes more relevant late game, so you purchase the sightstone early game, and upgrade it again at 30+ minutes.

Because of how quickly wards can be killed late game (it's pretty hard to even put one down as an ADC can even kill it before it stealths), I propose this ruby sightstone buff.


UNIQUE passive: Ward Reinforcement - Wards dispensed by the ruby sightstone require six (rather than three) hits to be destroyed.


This helps give a ward a fighting chance when it's put down late game, and actually forces the enemy team to use a pink/scanner to kill the ward. It's also not a super-strong buff, meaning it doesn't make ruby sightstone a force rush, and some people might not ever even pick it up. It does give it a niche for late game, which I think is the perfect little nudge it needs.


Edit: Quick concern that Riot Baconhawk brought up with having wards at six health, scanning a ward with a tier 2 scanner generally gives a lone support time for five auto attacks. That means that a support with low base AS and no AA Reset (LEONAAAAAA) would not be able to kill a ruby sightstone ward in the time that it was scanned.

To sort of fix this while also solving another issue, it might be cool if all wards affected by a scanner instantly take one point of damage. As it stands, if a support scans a bush that has two wards, and they lack AS /AA reset, they can only do 5 hits, leaving one ward with one health. This would not only allow the reinforced ward to be killed by base AS in one scan, it would also help the lone support and reward good scan placement.


A less intrusive solution would be to have the passive provide a temporary shield, which is removed once the ward is stealthed.

I like the direction your suggestion is going. As already mentioned in some posts, increasing the limit of pink wards incetivizes the support to support to spend twice the gold to make effective use of the Ruby Sightstone. 

Going in Janna Mechanics' direction, perhaps he Ruby Sightstone would give wards place a 3-hit shield for the initial duration it is revealed to the enemy. Once it stealths, the shield goes away. This allows supports with low base AS to clear wards as they do now. But helps give wards the fighting chance they need when placed. 

Alternatively, to help boost pink ward play, particularly in the late game, perhaps the Ruby Sightstone's passive allows for pink wards (or just one.  Idk)  to be stored in the same slot as the Ruby Sightstone. This way supports don't need to keep a valuable item slot open for pink wards in the late game.
IMO sightstone should be its own trinket line, maybe let it replace yellows and recharge over time.  I'm neither for nor against the passive idea.

I have some Ideas for passives and actives that Ruby Sightstone could have that would make it more beneficial (none of which involve increasing your carrying capacity of vision or stealth wards!)

Possible Passives -

1. Upgrading to  Ruby SIghtstone increases cast range of wards to 1000 (like feral flare)
2. 5% movement speed boost after a ward is placed (decays over 3 seconds)
3. destroying an enemy ward grants an additional 50% gold 
4. Every ward placed grants 2 Mr and 2 armor (stacking up to 10 times) (limit 2 stacks per minute)

Possible Actives - 


1. For 6 seconds the closest enemy ward  in a 1000 range radius is revealed 
2. Activate Ruby Sightstone, your next stealth ward placed will be auto upgraded into a pink vision ward (max vision ward capacity on map is not increased) (120 second cooldown)
3. for 6 seconds, all enemy traps, wards, and stealthed units in a 1000 range radius are revealed (not very original, but useful)
4. Activate Ruby Sightstone - for 3 seconds all nearby allies will glow green if the enemy cannot see them through the fog of war, ally's that are visible will glow red. (this would help when trying to sneak a dragon or baron but you're not sure if the enemy has vision on you or not!)

My concern would be, "Is this a step backwards from the initial vision changes?"

Part of the reason changes were made to the vision game was to enforce the idea that warding isn't ONLY the support's job.  I feel like raising the ward cap on a support-centric item is reverting back to an unhealthy mindset.  I would rather see a ward cap increase on a trinket, since all players, regardless of position/role, are more inclined to use trinkets (mind you, Riot made trinkets free just so non-support players wouldn't have a reason NOT to get one).

Getting non-support players into the vision game was hard to begin with; let's be wary of giving them an excuse to opt out once again.

I agree that Ruby Sightstone definitely needs some love, and I'd like to talk about their current gold efficiency. Using the rules established on http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/, as well as referencing the item pages themselves, {{item:1028}} is our most basic Health efficient item, thus every point of health is worth 2.67g.

---

{{item:2049}} 800g
+150 Health
Contains 4 ward charges that refresh when at the shop
You can consume a charge at any time to place a Stealth Ward (normally 75g)

The health has a gold value of 400g, giving it 50% efficiency without the passive
Each ward placed increases the efficiency by 9.4%, hitting 100% at 6 wards and increasing indefinitely

---

{{item:2045}} 1600g
+400 Health
Contains 5 ward charges that refresh when at the shop
You can consume a charge at any time to place a Stealth Ward (normally 75g)

The health has a gold value of 1067g, giving it 66.7% efficiency without the passive
Each ward placed increases the efficiency by 4.7%, hitting 100% at 8 wards and increasing indefinitely

---

There is, however, one bug issue with the Ruby Sightstone in regards to it's efficiency. By the time you'd be interested in building it, you've already got 100%+ efficiency out of the regular Sightstone's passive, making the ward dropping portion of the item worthless in regards to gold efficiency. While I can't speak for other players, I know that after I get a normal Sightstone, I start aiming to build my boot item and then a typical support item, and by the time I've finished those I've placed well beyond 6 wards, especially if I'm having a long laning phase.

The only benefit from Ruby Sightstone would be having the one extra charge when I'm roaming, which feels unnecessary. It feels like, by the time my 3 wards I've placed have vanished, I've either already backed and restocked, or I'm just not in a good position to be roaming and placing wards since I'm likely needed elsewhere. This means that for me to feel it's worth building Ruby Sightstone (aside from finishing my build) is that the one extra ward charge has to be worth a whopping **533g**

I do think that for me to desire Ruby Sightstone as it is now, it needs something. Being able to place one more Stealth Ward could be just the ticket, and/or perhaps even just dropping the cost simply because of how inefficient it feels. The only issue I can see with changing Ruby Sightstone, is that some champions ({{champion:64}}) simply buy it to make themselves more mobile, rather than for the vision. Either way, it could be a fun pre-season experiment :)

There is one flaw in your argument:

The health of Ruby Sightstone is worth 1067g, leaving 533g.

However you also said that the basic passiv already makes up the first 400g from the regular sightstone.

That leaves only 133g for the ubgraded charge.

Personally I think it is worth alot. There have been times when I was warding our jungle, while defending inner tower and then suddenly pushing to their inner tower and having to ward enemy jungle.

Maybe I should have been more clear, but in that context I was referring to the **upgrade cost efficiency** not Ruby Sightstone's item efficient. The point of that was the difference between Ruby and regular Sightstone is 800g, but all you get is 250 HP (667g) and...

Huh, weird. That means the charge only costs 133g, hmmmmm.... Guess I didn't think that all the way through in focusing on the upgrade specifically, while referencing the item itself.

Well, thanks for the catch and making me double check myself.

> Maybe I should have been more clear, but in that context I was referring to the **upgrade cost efficiency** not Ruby Sightstone's item efficient. The point of that was the difference between Ruby and regular Sightstone is 800g, but all you get is 250 HP (667g) and...
> 
> Huh, weird. That means the charge only costs 133g, hmmmmm.... Guess I didn't think that all the way through in focusing on the upgrade specifically, while referencing the item itself.
> 
> Well, thanks for the catch and making me double check myself.

Yes the stack is only 133, which is cheaper than a regular ward.  However, the 1 extra stack and 250 hp is not useful enough to warrant purchase OVER other items.  My concern as support is that, especially now with our utility scaling from AP, 800 gold is a big investment.  It is not about the "efficiency" of the gold cost.  It is about whether the item is an efficient buy.  Bloodthirster is very gold efficient too, but that doesnt mean I will be buying it on my supports any time soon.  My argument was about the fact that what you get out of Ruby Sightstone specifically, while being gold efficient, is not ROLE efficient.  Having 1 extra stack is not going to make or break the game.  In fact I find that very rarely do I ever have to use the 5th ward stack before returning to base(unless my team is not warding at all, but that is a completely different issue).

I know what you and everyone else is saying.  The only argument is not just about the gold to benefit ratio.  It is about the benefit to role ratio.  As a support I usually have the fastest movespeed(excluding a few instances) so I can afford to back a few extra times per game.  Meanwhile, I spend my gold on some well deserved AP or other important things.  800 god does not seem like much to any other role since they get farm.  Even with the new support items you still get less gold than everyone else but are expected to buy a ward dispenser(and later upgrade it) for the cost of a vamp scepter(2 with upgrade).  A vamp scepter to an ADC is a small investment, most times I see ADC's buying at least one other item with it, but to a support that is usually all I buy if I get it first trip back.  As to the 800 gold to go from Sightstone to Ruby?  A little more math, Bilgewater Cutlass is only 1400 gold, Sheen = 1200, and a needlessly large rod is the same price... 1600 gold.

So in closing, I will state it one more time.  Gold efficiency is right on target for the SightStone item tree.  From a role stand point though, 1600 gold is an incredible investment compared to what you COULD be buying.  You can argue that it is the support's job to get sightstone, but then why did Riot rework the whole vision thing to help supports?  Now the only thing I have seen to compensate for this cost, is the increase in mage bot "supports".  Even I do this a lot.  Lux, Ziggs, Morgana.  It is all the same.  I see LOTS of AP and no gold income on them.  So how do they get the gold for it?  By getting kills.  Which usually pisses off the markman.  In reality, the issue arises from the idea of a role completely designed to baby some spoiled douche, but no one wants to say it.

I very very rarely even get to the Ruby Sightstone (support main). It's almost always the very last buy for a full build Support for me, so I don't think extra ward limit on it is useful in the slightest. I think there should be an alternate upgrade, such as;

* **Sapphire Sightstone** - [Sightstone + Mana Crystal] 200HP 300Mana 5 ward charges
* **Onyx Sightstone** - [Sightstone + Cloth Armor] 200HP 40Armor 5 ward charges
---
Or, an upgrade to the Ruby Sightstone such as;

* **Diamond Sightstone** (stole name from Meshach) - [Ruby Sightstone + Forbidden Idol] 450HP 10MP5 10%CDR Unique Passive: Any CDR above 40% is converted into another attribute (say, MS, Armor, AP, or MR).
---
I personally want an item that can make use of CDR above 40%. There are so many good support items with CDR that (for me, at least) when we get to late game I have to buy atypical items that aren't supporty (Like, I already have Talisman 10%, Mikhael's 10% , Zeke's Herald 20%, and Locket 10%. That's already 10% over even if I didn't have the 10% CDR masteries. Twin Shadows is a waste, Morellonomicon is a waste, Frozen Heart is a waste, Ardent Censer is a waste. So I just get a GA or Abyssal Scepter maybe).
*Actually now that I think about it, you could just make post-40% CDR conversion the final mastery in Utility...*

What is your reasoning for thinking those items are wastes? Only for the CDR effect or as items overall? Because I'll tell you what, playing as a carry, it's infinitely annoying to have your attack speed, lifesteal, or movement speed nerfed. And Ardent is a lovely item especially on champions like Janna who have incredible synergy with it. I actively watch the attack speed allies are getting from AC, and I assure you, it's noticeable.
I'm only saying the CDR on them is wasted, not the entire item is a waste.
Super agree! I only buy a ruby sighstone if it goes super late and I have nothing else to buy

I like to buy wards no matter what role I'm playing, but once I get to late game, I have to choose between having some wards in my inventory, or finishing my build.  Supports have even more trouble reaching a "true" full build because of the sightstone taking up room in their inventory.  I have two ideas for a potential solution:

-Remove wards from the store.  Have a "ward" key you can press for both types of ward.  If you can afford it, when you press the ward key you'll spend the gold (75/100) and drop down a ward.  The limit of 3/1 wards placed is still in effect, but you no longer have to go to the store to stock up ahead of time.  If you have a sightstone and place a ward, it is free, then the sightstone goes on cool down.  Wards will cost as normal (or perhaps reduced) until the sightstone is off of cool down.  Or maybe it has charges that replenish, or something.

OR,

-Have a slot for stealth wards, and a slot for a vision wards, over by the area where the trinket goes. I do NOT main support so I do feel like I am posting in a post not intended for me. However, I feel like the sightstone is the most powerful item in the game I try to get it no matter what position I play except for ADC where the support has the area covered. (If my support isn't warding then I buy one anyway)

We all seem to agree that SOMETHING needs to be done to the ruby sightstone to make it viable as I, like everyone else, don't see the point. I think that an increase in the limit on stealth and vision wards passive would be an amazing upgrade on this item. (Preferably the vision [pink] wards) Having only one allowed has always made purchasing them risky in my opinion. Where if you place it somewhere people usually go you risk it being taken out early. (the obvious and accepted risk) The usually overlooked risk, however, is the one that is taken on when you risk wasting money by buying a second pink ward without your first being gone yet. It is a waste of gold that could be enough to keep you ahead on items in lane.

Adding a second pink ward with the item would not remove this risk, but diminish it a little bit hand help a lot with watching the junglier ganks (specifically helping mid-laners in solo queue who don't know the enemy jungle's tendency's and have to guess which side to keep warded)

This would make life harder for the jungler. If this update were to take place then I think a cool down reduction would have to be put on the scanner. If the number of wards out there goes up, then the ability to get rid of them (to keep the balance) would have to go up as well.

This is just my view on the topic trying to look at it from the most affected positions by it. Any added discussions or counter-arguements are accept and welcomed.
